title: Acanthosis Nigricans: Clinical Overview and Classification
short_description: Clinical document describing acanthosis nigricans, a skin condition characterized by hyperpigmentation and velvety thickening of skin folds.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of acanthosis nigricans (AN), a dermatological condition marked by abnormal hyperpigmentation and hyperkeratosis of the skin, particularly in fold regions such as the neck, groin, and axillae. The document outlines the various forms of AN, including benign inherited forms, those associated with underlying syndromes, obesity-related cases, drug-induced variants, and malignant forms associated with cancerous tumors. This resource serves as an educational guide for healthcare professionals to understand the different classifications and potential underlying causes of this skin condition.
